content.description: Raindance is a classic route... I was skeptical but it is really good.  Well left of the Davidson Wall and just right of the black rock near the pond, partly obscured by trees.  Climb up an obvious feature through the trees and over a roof, then continue up really good rock via discontinuous cracks.  A great climb.

Not quite a savant. Don't want to be playing with a full deck. 4 star movement on really steep terrain. The only down side is the precarious nature of the blocks through out the initial roof. 

  Leave ground on bobbles. Fiddle jewelry throughout the steeeeep roofs, push in. Exit final roof through ape land. Mantle onto the belay ledge. 

  Continue up steep mixed sport cracks to belay ledge.
content.protection: 2+ of those  Micro Cams #000 C3- #.75 C4   Small Nuts   Many Runners

content.description: Raindance Buttress is a section of broken wall located to the left of the Davidson Wall, sort of in a kink in the canyon wall. The rock might look a bit shattered, but an ascent of Raindance via lead or TR is WELL worth your time.
